Wynton Marsalis to continue jazz tradition tomorrow

Fortythree albums in  years and he still has time to tour PERIOD

Ninetime Grammy winner Wynton Marsalis will swing his jazz into Eisenhower Auditorium tomorrow night as part of Lincoln Center Jazz Orchestras tour United in Swing PERIOD

Marsalis career began during childhood when at the age of  he played his first trumpet notes PERIOD Since then he has recorded numerous albums and now sits atop LCJO as its music director PERIOD

Under Marsalis leadership the LCJO is a fifteenpiece jazz outfit specializing in breathtaking solos around the stage PERIOD Playing original material as well as drawing on the masterpieces of Louis Armstrong and John Coltrane Marsalis and LCJO have been a driving force behind jazzs movement into American culture PERIOD

Wynton Marsalis

Time The performance begins at  p.m. with Artistic Viewpoints preceding it at  p.m PERIOD Date Tomorrow Place Eisenhower Auditorium Tickets  for general audience  for students and  for Penn State students and for children  and under PERIOD

 said Jesse Tampio public relations associate of Jazz at Lincoln Center PERIOD 

Jazz as an entity is a modern alwayschanging musical movement but LCJOs covering of jazz legends isnt in tribute but rather in spirit Tampio said PERIOD

 Tampio said PERIOD 

At Penn State a growing acceptance of jazz has propelled the Center for Performing Arts to book more and more jazz concerts this year PERIOD

 said Laura Sullivan director of marketing and communications for the Center for the Performing Arts PERIOD 

Preceding the show LCJO performers saxophonist Victor Goines and alto saxophonist Wess Anderson will entertain questions and hold discussion with the audience at  p.m PERIOD The show itself is scheduled to last two hours but Sullivan hasnt confirmed the length given by 

 Sullivan said PERIOD

Sponsored by Phillip Morris  will be the Center for the Performing Arts last jazz show this semester PERIOD More shows for next semester will be announced at the end of April PERIOD

LCJO has played in venues ranging from jazz clubs to public parks to riverboats but Saturday night they drop in on Eisenhower Auditorium PERIOD

Tickets are priced at  for general audience  for students and  for Penn State students and for children  and under PERIOD

The show starts at  p.m PERIOD preceded by the Artistic Viewpoint at  p.m PERIOD
